author: Richard Carranza, Houston Energy Industry Examiner
title: Houston workshops on energy, July 2015
text:
Houston workshops on energy, July 2015 Use your key for the next article Comment Play With $4bn and a new government office, the White House has unveiled its latest clean energy initiative and cast a subtle new role for the federal government: not only is it a funder of new research, of the latest solar converter or biofuel source, but... on.aol.com 
Workshops in the Houston Area are abundant. So many of these workshops are just simply on-going. Every now and then a workshop comes up that is unique: usually simply a stand alone workshop or a workshop connected to a conference. Venues for any of these workshops include George R. Brown Convention Center, Hilton Post Oak Galleria, Marriott Hotels located at the Galleria and Westchase, and Norris Conference Center located at CityCenter, just to name a few. Note that many workshops are held by companies at their own business offices. The workshops offered here are all business related, and connected in some way to the Houston energy industry . The organizations that sponsor the workshops vary in type: industrial, consulting, universities, and even government. The only way to find out about many of these workshops is to get out there at the meeting and hussle to find out about them; or, you can just come right here to the website. 
Offshore Energy Center Workshops
